TopicTitle: Which platform would you prefer to play KSP2 on?

Articles.Content: There has been a lot of discussion about that availability of KSP2 on Mac/Linux, and one question that has never been well answered is what proportion of players play on these platforms.  Hopefully this poll will shed some light on the matter.
I would play it on Windows, but I'd like some Linux support for the Steam Deck.
100% Windows. No chance I'll ever play it on another platform
I prefer my gaming on Console. KSP is the exception because I need K+M support to be halfway decent at it.
Ill be playing on PS5, i really rreally hope the console release isnt too late after the PC release.
Windows. Can't imagine not having mods for KSP, it's like 90% of the game
Mac or Linux for me, for the same reason as above. If there is console cross play, I'll think about it.
Definitely Mac for me.  The results of the poll are very interesting.  Both Mac and Linux have more players than Console, yet they're not confirmed and Console is.
You should have put in a distinction between Linux and Proton, apparently for some people that matters.

Ah, I did miss a platform.  Until now I had never even heard of Proton.

Edit:  Turns out Proton isn't really a platform.  Probably I should have asked which version of the game people want.

Edited July 24, 2022 by Ember12

7 hours ago, Ember12 said:

Ah, I did miss a platform.  Until now I had never even heard of Proton.

Edit:  Turns out Proton isn't really a platform.  Probably I should have asked which version of the game people want.

Nope Proton isn't a platform, is a way to make Windows games work on Linux and more and more devs are targeting that over a native version, but for some people that's unacceptable. 

It's what the SteamDeck uses.

On 7/24/2022 at 2:53 PM, Master39 said:

Windows + SteamDeck

If SteamDeck is considered a viable option then surely iPad / Mac Hybrid version should be considered just as viable. Sure iPad version would need some fairly aggressive min. spec hardware support but still certainly the iPadPro and current models match re-exceed KSP 1 hardware.

I know the M1 chip specs are pretty impressive, but I think that quite a lot of things would chug on integrated graphics. You could argue that you could crank down graphics to the minimum, and that is possible, but builds in excess of 100 parts would probably lag. A lot.

On 300+ part ships my RTX 3060 dedicated graphics chugs, so... ;-;
